meanings.definition: To make something too uniform or similar in nature.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overhomogenize her outfits by always wearing the same colors.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overhomogenize the flavors in a dish by adding too much of one spice.
meanings.sent3: Don't overhomogenize your playlist with only one genre of music; mix it up a bit!
meanings.sent4: His strict rules overhomogenize the classroom, making it hard for students to express themselves.
meanings.sent5: The artist didn't want to overhomogenize her paintings, so she used a variety of colors and styles.

meanings.definition: To blend or mix something excessively.
meanings.sent1: The chef tends to overhomogenize the ingredients in his recipes, resulting in bland dishes.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overhomogenize the paint colors or you'll end up with a muddy mess.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally overhomogenized the smoothie, turning it into a strange, unappetizing sludge.
meanings.sent4: The DJ overhomogenized the music playlist, playing the same song on repeat all night.
meanings.sent5: The company's attempt to overhomogenize their products led to a loss of unique features that customers loved.
